meanings.definition: To adjust or rearrange in a new way.
meanings.sent1: She was rejiggering the furniture in her room to create more space.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was rejiggering the engine to improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: After rejiggering the puzzle pieces, she finally solved the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His rejiggering of the recipe turned the bland dish into a flavorful delight.
meanings.sent5: The artist's rejiggering of colors brought life to the painting.

meanings.definition: The act of making changes or adjustments.
meanings.sent1: The rejiggering of the schedule caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent2: His constant rejiggering of the plan led to delays in the project.
meanings.sent3: The rejiggering of the seating arrangement made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rejiggering of the budget was necessary to meet the financial goals.
meanings.sent5: Her rejiggering of the presentation captivated the audience.
